body:
### Steps to reproduce

@tgamblin, @eugeneswalker  @sleak-lbl 
cc: @bonachea: reported this same issue and i suspect other NERSC users will have this same issue

Spack can't bootstrap clingo for some reason and therefore spack is not usable on Perlmutter. To reproduce this error we have a script where we clone spack in a python environment and run `spack spec zlib` to get the error.

```
siddiq90@login26> cat spack_clingo_reproducer.sh 
#!/bin/bash
python3 -m venv /tmp/spack_pyenv
source /tmp/spack_pyenv/bin/activate
spack_root=/tmp/spack
rm -rf $spack_root
git clone https://github.com/spack/spack $spack_root
. $spack_root/share/spack/setup-env.sh
spack spec zlib
spack debug report
```

The current workaround is to `pip install clingo` in your environment to make sure this works without having to bootstrap clingo from source.

Here is the script

```
siddiq90@login26> cat spack_clingo_reproducer_working.sh 
#!/bin/bash
python3 -m venv /tmp/spack_pyenv
source /tmp/spack_pyenv/bin/activate
pip install clingo
spack_root=/tmp/spack
rm -rf $spack_root
git clone https://github.com/spack/spack $spack_root
. $spack_root/share/spack/setup-env.sh
spack spec zlib
spack debug report
```

```
* **Spack:** 0.17.1-748-5091dc2124
* **Python:** 3.6.13
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-zen3
* **Concretizer:** clingo
```

Until this is fixed we rely on `pip install clingo` but this can be problematic for users using spack in a deployment process. Everyone will need to install clingo in their python environment not to mention user need to be in the correct instance, pyenv, or conda to get this working. Its not clear if user configuration in `~/.spack` has anything to do this with but
